official-title.#text:
To facilitate affordable workforce homeownership in, and
		  develop the full-time resident communities of, high tourism areas, and for
		  other purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for
			 a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for
			 consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the
			 committee concerned

short-title.#text:
Affordable Housing Regulation
			 Simplification Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Inapplicability
			 of certain Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac guidelines to affordable workforce
			 housing mortgages

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Subsection (b) of section
			 302 of the Federal National Mortgage Association Charter Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal National Mortgage Association Charter Act/s:302/ss:b

text.#text:
the corporation may purchase,
				service, sell, lend on the security of, and otherwise deal in any affordable
				workforce housing mortgage; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				not apply to any affordable workforce housing mortgage.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal National Mortgage Association Charter Act/s:302/ss:b/p:7/sp:A/cl:i

text.#text:
any requirements and guidelines of
				the corporation that are inconsistent with the authority under

Notwithstanding
				any other provision of law—

continuation-text.#text:
and any
				multifamily housing development that otherwise complies with the requirements
				under this subclause may not be considered ineligible because the development
				or any portion of the development is called or referred to as a

text.#text:
is
				located within or is part of a multifamily housing development—

that consists of 5 or more dwelling units
				or a mixed-use development that is not less than 50 percent residential, as
				defined in the legal description of the property in the purchase contract or
				mortgage or title documents relating to such purchase, or, if the development
				is less than 50 percent residential, has been granted an exception by the
				corporation;

of which not less than 25 percent of the
				dwelling units in the development are owner-occupied; except that the
				requirement under this item shall be considered to be complied with, with
				respect to a development, unless verifiable public records indicate an
				owner-occupancy rate for the development of less than 25 percent;

that may include dwelling units that are
				used for the sole purpose of short-term rentals and may provide such services
				as a staffed front desk, a concierge, or other amenities consistent with
				providing customer service for non-owner occupied or short-term rental units in
				the development, including marketing that describes the property as a lodge,
				resort, or other similar facility; and

is
				subject to resale restrictions that—

terminate upon foreclosure or
				execution of any deed-in-lieu-of-foreclosure; and

is
				located in an area that, at the time of the origination of the mortgage, is a
				high tourism area.

The
				mortgage shall be made for the purchase of, and secured by, a one-family
				residence that—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Housing and Urban Development

Director of
				the Federal Housing Finance Agency

text.#text:
that
				does not exceed 160 percent of the area median income, as determined and
				updated by the

not less than 75 percent of which is
				earned from positions the discharge of whose duties involved physical presence
				in one or more high tourism areas.

The household of the mortgagor shall have a gross
				household income—

has
				been employed, during the 6-month period ending upon execution of the mortgage,
				in a position or multiple positions the discharge of whose duties involved
				physical presence in one or more high tourism areas, in the aggregate, for an
				average of not less than 30 hours per weeks;

is
				employed at the time of the execution of the mortgage in a position or multiple
				positions the discharge of whose duties involve physical presence in one or
				more high tourism areas, in the aggregate, for an average of not less than 30
				hours per week and the duration of such employment in such position is expected
				to last at least 6 months;

is
				60 years of age or older and, during the 5-year period ending up the
				mortgagor’s retirement from employment was employed in a position or positions
				the discharge of whose duties involved physical presence in one or more high
				tourism areas for—

an average of not less than 30 hours
				per week; and

for not less than 8 months per
				year;

is a person with disabilities (as such
				term is defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 811(k) of the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable
				Housing Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal National Mortgage Association Charter Act/s:302/ss:b/p:7/sp:B/cl:iii/scl:I
Federal National Mortgage Association Charter Act/s:302/ss:b/p:7/sp:B/cl:iii/scl:II

text.#text:
was employed, during the 2-year
				period ending upon becoming disabled, in a position or positions described in

, except that the 30-hour
				requirement under such subclauses shall not apply to such person if—

is employed in a position or
				positions described in

title
				XVI of the Social Security Act

text.#text:
compliance with such requirement would
				make such person ineligible for benefits made available for persons with
				disabilities through a program of any State agency for developmental
				disabilities or through the supplemental security income program under

is the head of household in a household
				that includes one or more dependents, at least one of whom is at the time of
				the execution of the mortgage 5 years of age or younger or is enrolled
				full-time in a school in a high tourism area.

The
				mortgagor or another member of the mortgagor’s household—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal National Mortgage Association Charter Act/s:302/ss:b/p:2

				comply with the applicable dollar amount limitations established pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 234 of the National Housing Act

header.#text:
FHA authority for
			 spot approval of mortgages for condominium units

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide an approval process for insurance of such
				mortgages that does not require prior approval of the entire project or of the
				homeowners association for the entire project.

text.#text:
In the case of
				individual mortgages for one-family units in a multifamily project and an
				undivided interest in the common areas and facilities that serve the project
				and affordable workforce housing mortgages (as such term is defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall, by notice issued not later than December 31,
			 2014—

text.#text: The

establish a
			 minimum threshold for such economic activity for use for designating counties
			 as high tourism counties; and

pursuant to such
			 procedure, metric, and threshold, designate the counties in the United States
			 that are high tourism counties at the time of such designation.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall reassess and update such designations on a biennial
			 basis.
